author: Amanda Kinseth
title: chevron-right
text: DARLINGTON COUNTY, S.C. (WPDE) â€” Families across our area are celebrating Kwanzaa, which kicked off Tuesday. Kwanzaa celebrates the values and principles of African American culture. READ MORE: [Sober NYE party at Myrtle Beach eatery invites guests to ring in 2024](https://wpde.com/news/local/dirty-myrtle-wing-company-hosts-sober-nye-party-for-those-going-through-sobriety-new-years-eve-new-year-2024-holiday-season-myrtle-beach-south-carolina-chicken-food-culinary-sober-alcohol-free-champange-toast-ball-drop) It was created by a California State University professor, Maulana Karenga, in 1966 as a way to bring people together. The seven-day holiday focuses on seven principles - unity, self-determination, responsibility, economics, purpose, creativity and faith. "January 1st, that is the day of faith. Our focus is on what is our relationship with our creator God, and then how do we bring other people to that realization. Kwanzaa means first fruits. It's really a harvest festival," said Darnell Byrd McPherson, First Steps Darlington County. You're invited to a family-friendly Kwanzaa celebration this weekend in Darlington County. It's Saturday from 11:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. at First Steps in Lamar.
